rake something ↔ in.translation[0].defin: to earn a lot of money without trying very hard
Lou’s been raking in the dollars since he opened his business.
If someone opened a burger bar, they’d really rake it in.
rake something ↔ in.translation[1].defin: to obtain money, profits etc in large amounts
Batman merchandise raked in an estimated $500 million in retail sales while it was hot.
